p:
Patients with pre‐existing comorbidities are thought to be at an increased risk of infection with SARS‐CoV2 and also tend to have worse clinical outcomes. Specifically, patients with cardiovascular disease, diabetes and hypertension are thought to have a high complication rate with mortality rate of 10.5% reported in cardiac patients and mortality rates of 7.3% and 6.0% for diabetes and hypertension patients, respectively.
